materials.raw_text: Cadmium (Cd): 60 g, Ruthenium (Ru): 10 g, Technetium (Tc): 10 g, Thulium (Tm): 90 g, Yttrium (Y): 110 g

sourcing.instructions: Cadmium: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Ruthenium: Specialty metal suppliers; Technetium: Radioactive material suppliers (ensure proper licensing); Thulium: Rare earth metal suppliers; Yttrium: Metal suppliers or online chemical stores.
steps: Cadmium: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Ruthenium: Specialty metal suppliers; Technetium: Radioactive material suppliers (ensure proper licensing); Thulium: Rare earth metal suppliers; Yttrium: Metal suppliers or online chemical stores.

1. Weigh each metal accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a fume hood, combine the weighed amounts in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Use a non-reactive stirrer to mix the metals thoroughly until a homogeneous blend is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each metal accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a fume hood, combine the weighed amounts in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Use a non-reactive stirrer to mix the metals thoroughly until a homogeneous blend is achieved.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and alloying of the metals.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and alloying of the metals.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (~25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it reaches this temperature to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (~25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it reaches this temperature to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified alloy from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a grinder to shape the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified alloy from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a grinder to shape the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to prevent oxidation.
